text: MIMAROPA, also known as Southern Tagalog Islands,Philippine Environmental Management Bureau "EMB Central and Regional Offices" ; retrieved 2013-4-23. now officially known as the Southwestern Tagalog Region, is a region of the Philippines.MIMAROPA is an acronym. It stands for Occidental MIndoro and Oriental MIndoro, MArinduque, ,ROmblon and PAlawan. It was also called Region IV-B. The provinces of the region are Occidental Mindoro, Oriental Mindoro, Marinduque, Romblon, and Palawan. "Executive Order No. 103, Dividing Region IV into Region IV-A and Region IV-B, Transferring the Province of Aurora to Region III and for Other Purposes" ; retrieved 2013-4-23. The capital is Calapan. Puerto Princesa Subterranean River National Park and El Nido Marine Reserve Park are in the region. == History == The MIMAROPA region was created by Executive Order No. 103 in 2002. == References ==
title: Mimaropa
